snippet: The European Central Bank and its president, Mario Draghi, want to ensure that their voices get heard beyond the financial district of Frankfurt. But their efforts to spread their message more directly to the citizens of Europe have ended up...
abstract: The European Central Bank and its president, Mario Draghi, want to ensure that their voices get heard beyond the financial district of Frankfurt. But their efforts to spread their message more directly to the citizens of Europe have ended up backfiring, at least when it comes to visiting Spain, one of the countries at the center of the Continent's debt crisis.

headline.main: Mario Draghi Takes the E.C.B.'s Message to Spain
